name: reclad
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to cover the surface of something again for a second, third, etc. time, to protect it: They will use standard materials to reinforce existing buildings, and re-clad where necessary. Unfortunately, the roof surfaces had been reclad with corrugated iron. The work to replace the roof and reclad the walls should be completed by December 20.
More examplesFewer examplesThe hideous building has been reclad and refitted to house the company's headquarters.The roof was reclad with new Welsh slates.The building was damaged in the explosion, and had to be reglazed and reclad.The poor quality buildings will be knocked down or re-clad.
